attributes.action: Ban extremist book Kitab at Tauhid (Darulsalam) by Sh. Ibn Abdul Wahab from UK
attributes.additional_details:
To solve a problem, we have to get to the root of the problem. And the root in terrorism is extremist ideologies that take verses out of context. This author has openly declared war on both muslims and non-muslims alike.
Evidences: i) Commins, David (2005). The Wahabbi Mission and Saudi Arabia.
ii) Vitalis, Robert (2007). Americas Kingdom.
iii) Naveed, Sheikh (2009). Suadi State, Wahhabi World: The Globalization of Musllim Radicalism
iv) Mr Hempher (2015). Confessions of a British Spy.
attributes.background: Islam as a religion has been hijacked by a minority of extremists. They derive their justification for suicide bombings and killing innnocent people all over the globe, by taking their main legal rulings from this book (Kitab at Tauhid) written by Sheikh Muhammad ibn Abdul Al Wahab.

rejection.details: The Government and Parliament do not have any powers to ban this book. If you want Parliament to pass a law which would give the Government this power, you could start a new petition about that.
